text.p: Alex. Brown analyst Peter Emch downgraded Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp to market perform from buy, his office said.
-- in research report, Emch cited deteriorating growth and unclear company direction.
-- lowered 1997 earnings estimate to $2.55 per share from $2.57 and cut the revenue estimate to $21.7 billion from $22.9 billion.
-- reduced 1998 earnings estimate to $2.93 from $2.97, and revenue estimate to $25 billion from $26.3 billion.

-- said "new management gives very few answers on conference call with investors, strategic direction and growth trajectory unclear." Emch said it "became clear on conference call...current management does not have a clear idea yet of what its growth plan will be."
-- said appears likely that Dr. Thomas Frist, new chairman and chief executive, will sell some assets and split up other parts of company to maximize asset value.

-- said U.S. Justice Department indictments of three company executives on fraud charges on Wednesday "is particularly negative, as it suggests that the government is targeting corporatewide practices."
-- trading had not opened as of 0944 EDT/1344 GMT. Shares closed off 11/16 to 33-13/16 on Wednesday.
